title: Am I allowed to put a cover I did of another song on Spotify? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, however you will have to purchase the right to sell the download (or stream). Most likely you will need to go to The Harry Fox Agency to get the proper permissions. There are services that will handle the administrative end and make simplify the legalities of it. I used a company called “Limelight” for a cover I did with Streetlab of “Blister in the Sun”. For a set fee, you will purchase a set amount of streams/downloads upfront. You may find in the long haul it might be more profitable to give your covers away for free and sell your originals. Good Luck!

You don’t need a licence for releasing cover songs online except for The United StatesCanadaMexicoPakistanIndiaIf it’s only released outside those countries there’s no problem. But you asked about Spotify and that’s actually even easier. Both Spotify and Deezer pay for their own licenses for cover songs. This means that you can distribute your covers to both of these services worldwide. But it requires you put in the correct metadata for your release so that Spotify can identify the owner and pay them. Oh, and of course you cannot use any samples or backing tracks unless they are your original work or you have the licenses/permissions required to use it.

Not only can bands put covers on Spotify, there’s lots of session musicians hired expressly for the purpose of doing covers of popular songs. Especially by people like Garth Brooks who are not on Spotify.
I don’t think you can do that. Also as a budding artist you would get more views and exposure if you use services liek Youtube, Soundcloud , Reverbnation etc.
